alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherokee, northern Cobb and southeastern Bartow Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Kennesaw State University, or near Marietta, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Holly Springs, Fair Oaks, White Water Park, Sweat Mountain, Kellogg Creek, Red Top Mountain State Park, Oak Grove, Kennesaw State University, Little River Landing, George Washington Carver St Pk, Lebanon, Due West, Sandy Plains and Hobgood Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
